pros: You'll be able to take care of a wide variety of patients
cons: Leadership at times can be severely lacking.

review_title: Major rebrand from Correct Care Solutions. This company is cheap.
years_at_company: Major rebrand from Correct Care Solutions. This company is cheap.
pros: Nice people to work with. You can get free leftovers from lunch meetings. Used to be a great work environment but I have sensed a change in that as they have grown.
cons: Different treatment for different departments. They are so cheap, they rarely close the office for holidays and offer only 3 “floating holidays” instead, they never close during major storms and bad weather- not once since I have been here. They never give yearly bonuses- at least not to non-management corporate employees. They don’t match 401k- but will make a contribution which they decide at the end of the year. They offer very minimal pay increases- I think less than 1%.
advice_to_mgmt: Perhaps stop cutting corners to save a few dollars.

pros: 12 hour shifts, Don't get called off for low census, Autonomy.
cons: Minimal raises (last one was $0.03 for the year), then hiring new staff at higher starting pay. No weekend differential but tell you there is in the interview, no room to grow within job site, Notifying management of a potential violations are ignored until last minute and they expect the floor workers to fix it, and pretend they were never told. Lots of turnover, can't call out sick unless you want guilt trips and told to come anyway "or else", then get yelled at for showing up. Hire staff full-time and then tell them they don't have enough hours to give them. Management picks and chooses who deserves "parties" for work anniversaries but several employees have been here close to 15 years and never got recognized.
advice_to_mgmt: Be consistent with rewards and punishments. Honor and express gratitude for those who go above and beyond. Be clear at hiring about pay, insurance, days/hours available to work. Give the new employees the training they deserve, not a quick 3 day training and expect them to "figure it out".

pros: Great working environment and Flexibility in Schedule
cons: Low pay needs to improve for the job that is required

review_title: A leaopard doesn't change its spots, only its name. Otherwise known as"Rebranding
years_at_company: A leaopard doesn't change its spots, only its name. Otherwise known as"Rebranding
pros: Not one that I can think of
cons: Executive Management and Senior Management
advice_to_mgmt: Practice what you preach. Just because someone smiles and says what you want to hear, does not mean they are the right person for the job. The new SVP has a clear agenda and does not mind discrediting good employees to make themself or their agenda look better. If this type of "work ethic" continues, another rebranding initiative is in the companies future. If you want to work long hard hours, not be supported by your leadership team and badmouthed by these so called professionals, this is the place for you. If not, RUN AWAY!!!!!

pros: Salary and benefits on par for industry
cons: Poor communication between CCS and work site
advice_to_mgmt: State facility was disorganized, dangerous, and poorly managed. It is not CCS's fault that the facility was so distressed, but it seems strange they would place employees in such an environment without any safety training. It seemed that CCS, the facility administration, and the union were not on the same page and had no process for talking to each other or cooperating to support the employee.

review_title: Leadership team sucks the life out of nurses
years_at_company: Leadership team sucks the life out of nurses
pros: Interesting work environment different everyday
cons: Horrific management style! Authoritarian, dictatorship, unfair, staff constantly forced going from nights into days and manager and educator do not pitch in! Unable to plan a life as the schedule changes and is put out weekly like 3 months in advance ridiculous Basically it’s only about management never the needs of employees. If you don’t like it basically you are told it’s about the needs of the facility. Manager was a raging alcoholic jerk always rude and agitated. He was asked to step down now he is the educator he ran off half the staff as manager Staff hate him. He was was told to step down but instead of hiring an amazing nurse into the position of educator when that position opened they chose the dictator former manager with no staff input. Now staff is all about to leave again because he is still acting like the dictator nurses hate and nurses are just really done with this oppressive management dictatorship who promotes a negative work environment.
advice_to_mgmt: Evaluate why staff leave and get rid of the problem person and you might quickly create a positive work environment. Try another management style besides dictator authoritarian.
